1.Text:
Blue sea, white beach, and a posh resort hotel that
seems almost out of place...

Never thought I'd get another invitation, honestly.
The girls usually leave me out in the cold, but every
so often they see fit to throw me a bone.

Okay, if I wait here some sort of guide should arrive
to show me the way—
Welcome, Cid. Thank you for coming all this way.
Did we keep you waiting long?
Nope, not at all. Are you two in charge this time?

Yes, we are. And with me here, I can guarantee your
vacation will be one of absolute comfort.
W-Wow... You really seem confident.

How about we pause the chit-chat and get you
inside to cool off? We have some cold drinks ready as
well.
Oh, I'll carry your bags. Is this everything?
Y-Yeah, thanks...

(Man, count on Zeta to always have things taken care
of in advance. She's really got this routine nailed
down.)

My mission this time is to ensure my lord has a
delightful experience. Simply say the word, and I'll
do whatever you want, whenever you want, wherever
you want.

And I hardly need say that I'm at your service, too.
This would surely be an awful lot for Zeta to handle
on her own.

No need to worry about me. Missions must be completed
to the letter.

And your relaxation is part of the mission. Thus, I
want you to rest up as much as possible, too.

(Wow, they're both ready and raring to go! Is this
what you'd call being a workaholic?)

(Feels like I've seen this somewhere before...but,
eh, whatever.)
*yawn*... That was some good sleep...
Good morning, Cid.

Looks like you had a nice rest. Good. You must've
been very tired.
(Uh, why are they both outside my room?)

I'll get your breakfast ready at once. I've been
waiting so you could enjoy it hot off the plate.

Today's menu will be bread and an omelet, along with
sausage and—

Hold on. Since we're here on this island
why not let him savor the bounty of the sea? Some
grilled fish or the like.

Oh, but I thought we'd save the seafood for dinner.
Besides, meat and eggs for breakfast will give him
energy for the day, no?

No, no, that'd be too heavy. Fish would be better
in the morning. Don't you agree, my lord?
You may be right.
But you like meat, too, yes?
You bet I do.
So fish or meat—
Which are you in the mood for?
...Maybe I'll have both.

(Oof, that was a lot... Can't remember the last time
I had a heavy breakfast like that. Uh-oh, what now—)
You forgot to put on sunscreen, Cid. Here, lay down.

You need to stay hydrated, too. I got some juice for
you, so make sure to drink it.

(These two are glued to me like flies
on you-know-what...)

(Hmm, I dunno... It's nice that they're passionate
about their work and all, but this is borderline
suffocating...)

Think you're up for a run, my lord? I was thinking we
could play a game of beach flags next.

I'd like to think I'm pretty good at it. So, I can
safely say you won't be bored.

Or how about some beach volleyball? As it happens,
I have a special court at the ready.

Hitting the ball with everything you have is bound to
burn off quite a bit of stress. Doesn't that sound
like the perfect after-meal activity?

How is that any different from beach flags? Sprinting
is fun, too, you know.

Yes, I'm sure it probably is. But after such a heavy
breakfast, I believe he should start with some
lighter exercise.

I wasn't saying he should just go all out right away.
We have to start with a warm-up, right?
...Okay, I'll do one and then the other.

(Guess they each have their own ideas of how to have
fun at the beach. And it feels like there's something
at play here where compromise is off the table.)

(What's really scary about those two is how despite
this clash, you don't see them butting heads
openly...)

(Still, I'm not really down with just leaving
everything up to them. A life without any sort of
adversity will get old fast.)

(Hmm... Yeah, okay! I definitely want something more
thrilling!)

2.Text:
I tried making iced tea for you today, Cid. Nothing
but juice all day isn't healthy, after all.

I'll put on your sunscreen today. I couldn't stand to
see your lordly skin get burned, so I'll make sure
every last bit of you is slathered down.
Y-Yay...

(The two of them are back at it again today... All
this seeing to my every need is starting to get
stifling.)

So, what fun shall we get up to today? Another round
of beach flags?

Relaxing and doing nothing at all also makes for a
fine vacation, you know. Too much activity can wear a
person out.
Doing nothing sounds kinda boring to me.

But it's an opulent manner of whiling away the time.
The decision is entirely up to Cid, of course.
Man, tough choice...

(Hmm... At this rate, I'm going to spend my entire
vacation being led around by the nose... Can't have
that!)

(But what DO I wanna do... There's gotta be something
fun—)

...That's it! Hey, Alpha, is it alright if I have fun
with some of the stuff around here...like, say, those
palm trees over there?

Wh-Why, yes, of course... You're free to use whatever
you like.
But what're you going to do with palm trees?

Well, you'll see once we get started. Since you're
here maybe you two can lend me a hand.

You got any saws laying around here, Alpha? Can you
go look?

And Zeta, I need some sheets and rope.
The toughest ones you can find.
Understood. I'll be back shortly.

My lord is fired up... Heehee, this should be
interesting.
Here you go. Please take care not to cut yourself.

Hey, thanks. Okay, now I'm going to cut down a few of
those trees.

Sorry to keep you waiting, my lord! Sheets and rope,
as requested.

...Whoa, you sure didn't waste any time. Need me to
help with anything?

Nope, I'm good. Building it is part of the fun with
this kind of thing.
Whew... Okay, all done!
Is this...
...A raft?

Yep. Just like every young man dreams of! I dub it...
"Angry Poseidon"!

There isn't a kid alive who doesn't dream of a voyage
on the high seas!

Well, I supposed I'd be lying if I said I've never
thought of it.

But a kid can't afford a ship. So instead
everyone tries to build rafts like I have here. And
the key is doing it using materials you gathered
yourself.

...Wait. Do you seriously intend to take that out to
sea?
Uh, yeah. And?

I hate to see all your effort go to waste, but if
you're going out to sea, shouldn't it be on more of a
proper boat? This little dinghy is much too dangerous.

If you insist, then I'll come along. It does seem
like it'd be fun. You don't mind, right, my lord?
Mm... I'd planned on going alone, but okay.
...In that case, I'll come, too.

Oh, no need to trouble yourself. I've got this
covered.

No, it's my responsibility as the person in charge.
It wouldn't do to leave the two of you on your own.
...Fine.

You guys worry too much. It's not like I was planning
to go far.
I'm not worried so much as... You know, never mind.
Okay. Now that that's settled...time to set sail!

Wow, the hotel looks so small now... We must be
quite a ways out.

Are you sure this is okay? The wind feels a little strong
to me... And the sea is starting to get
choppy—
...Um, my lord?! A wave!
Uh-oh—

(Angry Poseidon is all busted up... Guess this is
what they call getting capsized, huh.)
(...Huh? Wait, this plot twist could only mean...)

(It's decided! Those two will be fine, so it's time
to let myself get swept overboard!)
Zeta, Cid has been swept away by a wave!
I know that! We've got to go after him!
Unh...
Cid! Thank heavens you're all right!
Are you okay? Any injuries anywhere?
No, nothing in particular, but...where are we?

...My lord, I'm going to need you to stay calm and
listen.

It would appear that we've washed up on an uncharted
island...

3.Text: An uncharted island...?

Yes. We have no idea of its distance or relative
position from the resort.

We were tossed into the ocean, and then you got swept
away, so there wasn't any time to think of that.
...Oh, so that's how it went down.

Anyway, for now let's have a look around the island.
We just might learn a few things.

Good idea. How about we split up and do a
preliminary check of the island?

In that case, I'll set off in the opposite direction
of Zeta. Then once she and I meet, we'll return here.
Gotcha. Be careful, you two.

...Heheheh! The raft capsized! And then I was thrown
into the ocean, shipwrecked! And now I've washed
ashore on a strange island! It's perfect!

This plot turn, this location, can only mean
one thing! Fun is coming my way!

...Nothing. No traces of inhabitants, much less
settlements.

Same. I didn't find anywhere that looked like it'd
seen the touch of human hands.

As much I'd been avoiding the thought...it looks like
this island is uninhabited.
Yes, I do believe that's the only conclusion.
I see...

(Oh hell yeah! Just as I predicted! A deserted
island!)

(Just as I was getting sick of my oh-so-perfect
vacation, I'm thrust into desert island survival
mode!)

(Survival... Ahh, just the sound of the word is music
to my ears! That jaunt on the raft was definitely
worth it!)

This is quite the fix we're in here, especially when
you consider we lack almost any sort of information
needed to return to the resort...

And it's plain to see that going back out on the
water heedlessly would only make the situation worse.

Which means...the wise course of action would
probably be to sit tight here for the time being
until help arrives.

The staff at the resort will most likely have noticed
we're missing by now.

But in the meantime we'll have to fend for ourselves.
Think you can manage that, Cid?
Sure, no problems here.

(Yes, here it is! Exactly what I'd been hoping for!
There are be no amenities to be found here!)

(Just self-sufficiency, each of day of life a hard-
fought victory! Kiss that cushy vacation goodbye!)

(And if this starts to get boring... Well, I'm sure
we'll reach land at some point if we start swimming.)

(But the main point is, living off the land is part
of every boy's dream! And I'm gonna make the most of
it!)

(I feel kinda bad for Alpha and Zeta...but I'll bring
them along for the ride. Think of it as training.)
To think this is what our vacation has turned into...
Seriously. An absolute disaster.

(It's just the three of us here on this island. So
living here by our own means...)

(...is pretty much the same thing as living with
Master Shadow...!)

Since we're going to be here for a while, our first
move should be getting the essentials covered.

Each and every day must be lived with care. And then,
eventually, the three of us will escape this rock!
Of course. Still—
It wouldn't hurt to take it easy for bit, would it?
...Huh?

4.Text:
Okay, before we do anything, we need to make sure we
have what we need to survive.

Which would mean...securing food and a place to
sleep, yes?

Yeah. We'll split up the workload and get what
we need by sunset.

Very well. Then you and I will see to making the
shelter and fire, my lord. In the meantime, Zeta can
procure drinking water and provisions—
Not so fast.
Oh, is something wrong?

That amount of might be a bit much, even for me.
Especially under a time limit.

You should be able to handle the shelter and fire
just fine on your own.

That's why I was thinking Master Shadow should be out
there working with me. Doesn't that seem more
efficient?

Yeah, guess I can see the logic in that. Okay, I'll
go with Zeta—
I'm not so sure of that.

I'm grateful you have such faith in my abilities. But
I have just as much faith in yours, Zeta.

I have no doubt that securing food and water will be
a simple task for someone of your skill.
Ahaha, you think too highly of me.
Not at all. I know you can do it.

Besides, building shelter will also require more than
one pair of hands. If we're speaking of efficiency, 
shouldn't this be where we assign two people?
Nah, you got this, Lady Alpha.
Now who's thinking too highly of someone?
(Welp, here we go again...)
Uh, hey... How about this?

I'll find the food and water, and you guys handle
shelter and fire. How does that sound?
...Well, okay. If you say so, my lord.
*sigh*... Very well. I'll abide by your decision.
O-Okay, then... Thanks.
I'm baaack! And I've got plenty of food and water—
...Huh?

Welcome home, Cid. I should have known that wouldn't
take long for you.

Wow, you have meat and even fish. Today's dinner is
going to be a real feast.
D-Did you build this yourselves...?

Yes, though it isn't quite finished yet...
Unfortunately neither of us are Eta.

(No, this is already way too much! I was expecting
just some leaves laid out and that's it...)
And this glorious bonfire...?

Yep, that's our work, too. Were you hoping for
something bigger?

(Never imagined this either... Even just a tiny
campfire would've been more than enough.)

(Oh right, I forgot... I'm dealing with a perfect
super being and a genius here...)

Um...thanks, both of you. But I would've been fine
with something a little more simple...

No. Even on a desert island, any inconvenience to
your person is unacceptable.
Oh, uh, okay. Thanks...

Speaking of, I had a little time left over, so I
whipped you up a hammock. It's there for you if you
start to get sleepy.

Won't he feel more at ease sleeping in a bed like
normal?
Uh, this is a desert island, so "being at ease" is—

Well, if that's your concern, I think a hammock would
make for a comfy place to sleep, too.

It's much too exposed for a setting where we have no
idea what to expect. He should be sleeping indoors,
in a bed.

...Okay, then I'll nap in the hammock during the day
and sleep in the bed at night.
Good. You can make use of both.

Yeah, that's probably the best option. What you say
does make sense, Lady Alpha.

Glad that's settled. Now it's time for me to
whip up some simple campfire cuisine and—

No, you wait right here, my lord. I'll make a fine
meal with those fish you caught.

Yes, after all it was you who put in the most work
today, Cid. As thanks, I'll use every skill at my
disposal to prepare your dinner.

This meat should become nice and tender with a good
stewing. I can add some herbs to mask the odor, and—
Let's save that for tomorrow. Today we're doing fish.

...And they're gone. Guess I can expect a full-course
dinner of fish and meat tonight.

But is roughing it on a desert island really supposed
to be this easy...?

5.Text: Mom, dad, Claire. How are you? Anything new going on?

I'm on a desert island now. How many days now has it
been since my raft and I washed ashore here? I can't
really recall.
But don't worry. I'm fine. After all—

Your coconut juice, Cid. I cooled it with spring
water.
Wow, this is ice-cold...
I found some fruit for you, my lord. Sweet and tasty.
Wow, so sweet...
(There's absolutely nothing "survival" about this!)

(Not enough water! Dwindling food supplies! No means
of escape in sight! Panic and suspicion on the rise!
That's what I imagined, but no.)

(If anything, it's only made the pampering worse! I
haven't faced a single hardship with food or shelter.
Never underestimate super-beings or geniuses!)
Dammit... It wasn't supposed to be like this...!
Is something wrong, my lord?
Nope, nothing!

About today's lunch...how does spiced fowl sound? I
caught some birds just this morning, so it will be
very fresh.

I've got some lively fish straight from the sea, too.
They won't last long, though, so I recommend we eat
them today instead.

Don't you think he's had too much fish lately?
He needs a more balanced diet.

If balance is your concern, then I'd think eating
more of something high in nutrients like fish would
be better.

(Again with the bickering... Were Alpha and Zeta
always on bad of terms like this?)

(At this point I'm beginning to think there's
something more going on than just strong preferences.
Not sure what it could be, though.)
Meat.
Nope, Fish.

...Okay, I'm going for a walk along the shore.
I'll come back once you've decided.

Ugh, I thought I was gonna suffocate back there...
Whatever beef they have going on is sucking all the
peace out of this island...

And it's not like they're outright fighting either.
Ah well, guess I'll just kill some time here—

Huh? There's something sticking out of the sand...
Is that a soda bottle? Why would that be here...?

And there's a paper inside... A regular ol' message
in a bottle. Somebody knows how to spice things up.
Let's see what it says...

"Thine eyes glimmer in the tenebrous dark. Behold,
the greatest bounty of shadows birthed into this
world..."etcetera, etcetera.
Hmm, that's a seriously cryptic message—
(Wait a sec! Could this be some sort of code?!)

(If so...it's gotta be talking about treasure!
It says "bounty," so what else could it be?!)

(Alright, no sign of Alpha and Zeta. This little
secret is all mine!)

(If those two learn about it, they may very well beat
me to the treasure... Caution is king here!)
Heheheh... Things are finally getting fun!

Smell you later, restful resort life and pampered
survival experience! This is now the summer of the
great treasure hunt!
...Master Shadow sure is taking his time.

Yes, and his dinner has gone cold. Perhaps he didn't
want fish or meat...?

Could that really be it? I thought he mentioned going
for a walk.
Either way, it certainly is concerning...
I'll go look for him.

I'll join you. I suppose there's enough beach for
both of us to check.

Um... Well, whatever. We can both go check by the
beach.

6.Text:
It seems he was definitely in this area. I see his
footprints.
...Hm? Is this—

A soda bottle? Gamma made something like this
before...

Exactly. She was super into it, going on about how
it'd be "a great contribution to our lord's cause."
Which may mean this island is...
What?

No, it's nothing. More importantly, Zeta, I want you
to go back to camp and wait for Cid. I'm going to
search further inland.

It wouldn't be good if he returned to camp and found
no one there, don't you agree?

Hey, don't try to pull that card now. I'll do the
searching.

Besides, this kind of work is more my specialty,
right? So, you should head on back to camp.

But I'm the one best-suited to deducing what he would
have done next.

And I'm saying I can track him even without doing
that. I AM a therianthrope, you know.
By the way, I've been thinking, Lady Alpha...

You've been kind of impatient ever since we came to
the resort, huh?

You should talk. What happened to your customary
adaptability?

I'm the same as ever. You're the one who's acting
weird. You keep trying to rush everything.

I'm not being impatient in the slightest. It's you
who’s being so competitive. What exactly are you
trying to do?

I...simply want to give our lord the best vacation
possible. What else?

I want the same. All I wish is for Cid to enjoy
himself, even in our current circumstances.
...Pfft, heheheh.
...Heehee.

Ahahahaha! So, you thought I was trying to compete
with you!
Heeheehee, I did. But I’m glad we're of like minds.

And on that note, let's stop holding each other back.
We need to work together to find Cid.

Yeah, let's. That stuff takes so much energy. Whew,
feels good to finally talk that out.

Now, with that taken care of, let's get moving. And I
do mean the two of us, as a team.

Agreed. The sun has almost set... We need to find Cid
quickly.
I smell Master Shadow over this way.

That's the opposite side of where we just were.
Maybe he cut through the forest to get here?

But what did he come all the way here for? A little
hardcore for a stroll, don't you think?
You have a point. Can you stay on the trail, Zeta?

...Hold that thought. We need to deal with that
nuisance first.

Whoa, that's a big bat. Where the heck has thing been
hiding?
It may very well be that this is...that thing.
What thing?

Never mind that. It seems our friend here is upset
that we entered its territory.

I see. But if you're going to interfere, don't expect
any mercy!
Indeed. You need to get out of our way.

7.Text: Okay...that takes care of that.
Yes, and now we need to hurry on ahead.
Hold up. Something's...coming through those bushes.
...Stay on guard, Zeta.
Yeah, I know. Now, what's up next—

Whoa, what a huge bat! Looks like it's dead now,
though. That really spooked me.
Ah, is that Master Shadow?!
Cid! There you are!
Alpha and Zeta?! What're you guys doing here?

(Could they be here to steal the treasure?! But how
did they find out?)
I'm so glad we found you...
Huh?

We got worried when you didn't return, so we came out
looking for you. It's a relief to see that you're
unharmed.
...What about the treasure?
Treasure? What treasure?
Oh, uh, well, if you don't know, that's fine.
(So, they aren't after the treasure... What a relief.)

At any rate, let's make our way back to camp. I need
to recook dinner.

Sure, fine by me. You haven't had anything to eat yet
today, have you, Master Shadow?
Now that you mention it, no...

(I was so fixated on the treasure that I forgot.
*sigh* Well, it's not like I found anything despite
scouring the entire island.)

Given the circumstances, I'll leave breakfast to you,
Lady Alpha.

Oh, how very kind. May I ask you to see to lunch,
then?
...Huh? Uh, yeah, thanks.
Hmm... Yeah, I dunno. I dont' get it at all.

I got so caught up in the moment that I thought it
just had to be treasure...but what was that note in
the bottle in the end?

"Thine eyes glimmer in the tenebrous dark." It sounds
like it just has to mean something. Eyes that glimmer
in the dark...

...A cat? Nah, gotta be something that fits the
island theme more, like say...a bird or monkey. But
if we're talking about the dark, it could be a bat—

Aha! What if it was that huge bat from yesterday?!
Could it be what the message was hinting at...?

But why? Anyway, doesn't change the fact that it was
nothing in the end, I guess.

(Can't help but wonder, though...what happened
between Alpha and Zeta? Up until yesterday, the
sparks were flying between those two.)

(But...I'm just glad everything's back to normal.
That makes things easier for me, too—)
Hm? Something's coming this way... Is that...a boat?!
I-I'd better go call the others!

My lord! And Lady Alpha and Zeta! We're here to bring
you home!

Good job finding us out here on this desert
island. How'd you know where to look?
Desert island...?

This island belongs to Mitsugoshi Resorts.
Construction is slated to begin soon, but yes, for
I suppose you could consider it uninhabited...
Huh?
That said, plans have been stalled due to monsters—

W-Wait a minute! Could it be that you sensed this and
came here to slay the beasts?!

You never cease to impress, my lord! Now construction
can proceed without fear!
O-Oh, yeah...

Yep, I knew. You picked up on it, too, right, Lady
Alpha?

I thought that might be the case as soon as I saw the
soda bottle. The encounter with monsters made me
doubly sure.
So, then what was that message in the bottle?
Message?
So, I actually found a note inside the bottle. Here...

(What?! This is...the poem for Master Shadow that I
tossed out to sea!)

(How in the world did it... No, no! Beta, you need to
get that poem back at once!)

...Oh, I'll take that off your hands. I'm sure it's
just someone's idea of a prank. I'll see that it's
disposed of properly.
Really? Well, okay, thanks.

(Guess I'll take the professional writer's word for
it. I am kinda grateful to whoever wrote it, though.
Prank or no, thanks for the dreams and adventure!)

Now, come on! Let's board the boat and get back to
the resort!

(Thus ends my desert island adventure, huh. Shame
about the treasure, but overall this was another
fun vacation.)

(Not to mention that Gamma said she has an event
planned once we get back to town. Summer is just
getting started!)

No more living with Master Shadow, I guess. I'm kinda
bummed.
Heehee... Yeah, I know how you feel.

A lot may have happened, but we must persevere as
members of the Seven Shadows.

...Right. Looking forward to continuing to work with
you, Lady Alpha.
